author: Taylor Noakes
description:
A well-connected lobbyist and advocate for fossil fuel resource development is one of eight applicants alleging the David Suzuki Foundation used misleading photographs in their promotional materials. As reported by the National Post, a Competition Bureau complaint alleges the foundation used “false and misleading” imagery in a fundraising activity. Though Stewart Muir is the only […]

The post Oil Advocate Behind Anti-Suzuki Complaint a Nameless ‘BC Resident’ in National Post Story appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Oil Advocate Behind Anti-Suzuki Complaint a Nameless ‘BC Resident’ in National Post Story

author: Sam Bright
description:
Reform UK’s oil industry interests are a major turn-off for voters, new research reveals. The think tank Persuasion UK tested five anti-Reform messages on 6,000 adults. According to the research, “by far the most impactful” message that dented support for Nigel Farage’s party was exposing its corporate, fossil fuel donors.  Five demographically-identical groups were shown […]

The post Exposing Reform’s Oil Ties Significantly Reduces Party Support, New Research Finds appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Exposing Reform’s Oil Ties Significantly Reduces Party Support, New Research Finds

author: Adam Barnett and Rei Takver
description:
Nigel Farage has spent his first year in Parliament giving speeches to radical right-wing groups close to President Donald Trump, making multiple trips to the U.S. to push his anti-climate agenda. As reported by DeSmog and The Mirror this week, the Reform UK leader has addressed the House of Commons on only 46 occasions over […]

The post With Friends Like These: Nigel Farage’s Year of Speaking at Radical Right-Wing Groups appeared first on DeSmog.
title: With Friends Like These: Nigel Farage’s Year of Speaking at Radical Right-Wing Groups

author: Brigitte Wear, Phoebe Cooke, Beloved John and Shauna Corr
description:
In a packed function room in Lagos, Nigeria, the jaunty sounds of Stevie Wonder’s ‘Sir Duke’ start to play. Then, as a giant sparkler and confetti cannon erupt, a curtain slowly parts to reveal a spinning display stacked with green, white and gold milk powder sachets. “Ornua has brought Ireland’s unique taste to Nigeria,” explains […]

The post How Ireland’s ‘Mediocre’ Milk Powder Made it Big in West Africa appeared first on DeSmog.
title: How Ireland’s ‘Mediocre’ Milk Powder Made it Big in West Africa
